intro: Phacelia exilis, commonly known as slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous small seeds in its flower heads. Phacelia exilis is often used in pollinator habitats due to its nectar-rich flowers.
